instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image or backlight, mac works
threads.message:
Hello, what i must check first? liquid was on that are where caps row are. everything is cleaned.

But still no backlight or image on screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image or backlight, mac works
threads.message: Start with a known good LCD+cable as water easily gets in there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image or backlight, mac works
threads.message: tested with working pcb, lcd and flex 100% ok. exact model of board is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 does anybody have this schematic+board view?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image or backlight, mac works
threads.message: Must know if it is backlight problem or image. Check very carefully with a strong light as it is very difficult to see on these LCDs. I currently do not have the diagram, it may be available though.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image or backlight, mac works
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image or backlight, mac works
threads.message: Fuse checked? What is the voltage on the backlight output? LCD connector not fried?
